snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, appearing on two American Sunday talk shows, reiterated that the best way to prevent Iran from acquiring a nuclear weapon was to draw a "red line" that, if crossed, would trigger military intervention. He...
abstract: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, appearing on two American Sunday talk shows, reiterated that the best way to prevent Iran from acquiring a nuclear weapon was to draw a "red line" that, if crossed, would trigger military intervention. He also denied that he was injecting himself into the American presidential contest.

headline.main: Israeli Leader Says Iran Is Closer to Building a Nuclear Bomb
